p: The MAPLE technique gained a lot of attention for the development of biocompatible and biomimetic coatings for implantable materials and devices, thanks to its properties, such as controlled topography of resulted nanosized layers, strong adhesion between synthesized films and implantâ€™s surface, and stoichiometric transfer of target materials onto the substrates [ 92]. Herein, we employed this versatile laser processing method to obtain composite PLA/Fe 3O 4@EG thin films at different laser fluences (200, 300 and 400 mJ/cm 2).
